transcript: Greetings, my friend. We are all interested in the future, for that is where you and I are going to spend the rest of our lives. And remember my friend, future events such as these will affect you in the future. You are interested in the unknown, the mysterious, the unexplainable. That is why you are here. And now, for the first time, we are bringing to you the full story of what happened on that fateful day. We are giving you all the evidence, based only on the secret testimony of the miserable souls who survived this terrifying ordeal. The incidents, the places, my friend we cannot keep this a secret any longer. Let us punish the guilty, let us reward the innocent. My friend, can your heart stand the shocking facts about grave robbers from outer space?
summary: Scene begins with a dramatic voiceover introducing a mysterious story involving extraterrestrial grave robbers and the future. The narrator promises to reveal the full story based on secret testimonies of survivors.

transcript: All of us on this earth, know that there is a time to live, and that there is a time to die, yet death is always a shock to those left behind. It is even more of a shock, when death, the proud brother, comes suddenly without warning. Just at sundown, a small group, gathered in silent prayer around the newly-opened grave of the beloved wife of an elderly man. Sundown of the day, yet also the sundown of the old man's heart, for the shadows of grief clouded his very reason.
summary: A small group gathers silently to pray at the newly opened grave of a deceased woman, shocking those left behind. The elderly husband is also grieving, as it seems this marks the 'sundown' of his own life.

transcript: The funeral over, the saddened group left the graveside.
summary: The scene depicts a solemn gathering at a graveyard for a funeral. Following the service, the mourners leave the gravesite.

transcript: It was when the gravediggers started their task that strange things began to take place. Fifteen to four. Yup, right on schedule. There's the ol' San Fernando Valley out there now. -You better radio in for landing instructions, Danny. -Right, Jeff. Burbank Tower, this is American Flight 812, over. Wouldn't surprise me any if  he's asleep this time of the morning. American Flight 812, this is Burbank Tower. If I were asleep you'd never get on the ground! Your case maybe you'd be up there for good. Over. You got me that time, Mac. This American Flight 812 requesting -
summary: Gravediggers begin their work at a cemetery as two pilots engage in a light-hearted radio conversation with air traffic control, referencing Burbank Airport (San Fernando Valley) and the possibility of one pilot sleeping.

transcript: Burbank Tower to American Flight 812, over. Burbank Tower to American Flight 812, over. Holy mackeral. -Burbank Tower to American Flight 812, are you in trouble? -Trouble ? -Take a look for yourself. -What in the world... -That's nothing from this world. Burbank Tower to American Flight 812, are you in trouble? Are you in trouble? -Mayday, mayday. Stand by, Burbank Tower. -Do you suppose the passengers saw it? I doubt it. Most of them are asleep. But it was quite a jolt, Jeff. I'll check. Good. We'll get them ready for landing. Keep it quiet until we get instructions. -Right. -American Flight 812 reporting to Burbank Tower, over.
summary: Pilot of American Flight 812 reports a strange and unexpected event during flight, possibly an unidentified flying object (UFO), causing turbulence. The tower advises them to prepare for landing while keeping the situation quiet.

transcript: (buzzing noise) -D'you hear anything ? -I thought I did. Don't like hearin' noises. 'Specially when there ain't s'posed to be any. -Yeah, sorta spooky-like. -Maybe we're getting' old. -Whatever it is it's gone now. -That's the best thing for us too. Gone. -Yeah, let's go.
summary: Two characters discuss an unusual noise they heard, expressing a sense of unease and concern. They decide to move on.

transcript: (The two men scream.)
summary: A distressing scene of two men in an emergency situation, evident by their screams.

transcript: The grief of his wife's death became greater and greater agony.
summary: The main character grapples intensely with the loss of his wife.

transcript: The home they had so long shared together, became a tomb. A sweet memory of her joyous living. The sky to which she had once looked, was now only a covering for her dead body.
summary: The scene depicts the empty home of a deceased woman, highlighting the stark contrast between her former vibrant life and the current state of solitude and silence.

transcript: The ever-beautiful flowers she had planted with her own hands, became nothing more than the lost roses of her cheeks.
summary: The scene depicts a woman mourning over the decay of flowers she had planted herself, symbolizing her own emotional decay, perhaps due to loss or heartbreak.

transcript: Confused by his great loss, the old man left that home, never to return again. (tires screeching; the man cries out in pain) (ambulance horn)
summary: The old man, grieving from a great loss, departs forever from his home, accompanied by distressing sounds of tire screeching and his own cries. An ambulance siren adds to the scene.

transcript: At the funeral of the old man, unknown to his mourners, his dead wife was watching. -First his wife, then he. -Tragic. -Tell me something. Why was his wife buried in the ground, and he sealed in a crypt? -Something to do with family tradition. A superstition of some sort. Well, it's getting' dark. Let's be on our way.
summary: At the funeral of an old man, his dead wife secretly watches. The scene is tragic as first his wife and then he are mourned. The conversation suggests a family tradition or superstition regarding burial methods.
cultural_refs: family tradition or superstition related to burial methods

transcript: Then, as two of his mourners left his final resting placeâ€¦ (screams) Look!
summary: A sudden scream is heard when two mourners depart from a deceased character's grave.

transcript: Minutes later, the police, led by Inspector Daniel Clay, arrived at the scene. -Who found him ? -The man and girl. -Medical, uh, examiner been 'round yet? -Just left. The morgue wagon oughta be along most any time. -You get their statement ? Yeah, much as we could. They're pretty scared. -Finding a mess like this oughta make anyone frightened. Have one of the boys take the guy and the girl back to town. You take charge. -Okay Inspector. What're you gonna do? -Look around a little. -Pretty dark out there. Once you get beyond the range of those lights you won't be able to see your hand in front of your face. -I will get one of the flashlights from the patrol car. -You be careful Clay. -I'm a big boy now, Johnny.
summary: Inspector Daniel Clay arrives at a crime scene and takes charge. He orders someone to take the two witnesses back to town. He intends to examine the area and plans to use a flashlight.

transcript: Looks like a bobcat tore into them. Yeah. Say Lieutenant, d'you get that funny odour ? -How could I miss it ? Oh, that'll be the morgue wagon now. -That's the fifth siren in the last hour. -Oh, something's happened down at the cemetery. A lot of police cars and lights. I stopped but I didn't see anything. Oh well, whatever it is, the morning paper will carry the whole story.
summary: Characters discuss a possible crime scene (cemetery) where a body might have been found, indicated by the presence of multiple police cars and sirens.

transcript: You seem to still be up there somewhere. Maybe I am. I don't think I've ever seen you in this mood before. I guess it's because I've never been in this mood before. Something about your flight ? Yeah. What happened, Jeff ?
summary: Two characters are having a conversation, one expressing concern about the other's mood which is seemingly different and unfamiliar. The second character may have experienced something significant (flight).

transcript: -I saw a flying saucer. -A saucer? You mean the kind from up there? -Yeah, or its counterpart. It was shaped like a huge cigar. Dan either saw it too. When it passed over, the whole compartment lighted up with a blinding glare. Then there was a tremendous wind that practically knocked us off our course. -Well did you report it? -Yeah, I radioed in immediately and they said well keep it quiet until you land. Then as soon as we landed, big army brass grabbed us and made us swear to secrecy about the whole thing. Oh, it burns me up. These things have been seen for years. They're here, it's a fact. And the public oughta know about it. -There must be something more you can do about it. Oh no there isn't. Oh, but what's the use of making a fuss. But last night I saw a flying object that couldn't possibly have been from this planet. But I can't say a word. I'm muzzled by army brass! I can't even admit I saw the thing! (loud whooshing noise)
summary: A character witnesses a UFO and is told to keep it secret by military officials, expressing frustration about the situation.

transcript: (another whooshing noise)
summary: Quick panning shot of a futuristic cityscape, followed by a close-up of the protagonist's face as they receive a distress call on their communicator.

transcript: (door creaks open)
summary: (Door creaks open) - A mysterious figure enters a dimly-lit room carrying an antique box

transcript: Sounds like Clay's in trouble. (Gun is empty.) (Clay screams and chokes.) Bet that apparition we saw had something to do with it. Come on.
summary: The protagonist, Clay, encounters a supernatural entity which causes him distress, indicated by his screams and choking sounds.
